post.description: Sets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: data
parameters.description: Data containing the callback endpoint to deliver the information

delete.description: Resets the communication endpoint address the service instance must use to deliver information about its health state, execution state, failures and metrics.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the registered listener

EntitySpecification.description: EntitySpecification is a class that offers characteristics to describe a type of entity. Entities are generic constructs that may be used to describe bespoke business entities that are not effectively covered by the existing SID model.

id.description: Unique identifier of this REST resource

href.description: Hyperlink reference to this REST resource

name.description: Name given to this REST resource

@type.description: Class type of this REST resource

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: The (immediate) base class type of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which this REST resource is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update of this REST resource

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status of this catalog item

AssociationSpecification.description: AssociationSpecification is an association class that describes a type of relationship between two entities. This is a generic construct that may be used to describe relationship types and roles. The role and type of each entity in the relationship is given by an association role specification. Two role specifications are embedded in the association specification.

id.description: unique identifier of the association specification

name.description: Name given to this association specification

@type.description: The (class) type of this association specification

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: Immediate base class type of this association specification

validFor.description: The period for which this specification is valid

lastUpdate.description: The last modified date of this specification

Category.description: The category resource is used to group product offerings, service and resource candidates in logical containers. Categories can contain other categories and/or product offerings, resource or service candidates.

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

validFor.description: The period for which the category is valid

parentId.description: Unique identifier of the parent category

isRoot.description: If true, this Boolean indicates that the category is a root of categories

EntityCatalogItem.description:
An EntityCatalogItem is an entity that allows any ProductOffering, ServiceCandidate, ResourceCandidate, or even any object inheriting from RootEntity, to be available to a catalog. The CatalogSpecification and Policy of the catalog governs the content of the EntityCatalogItem. This API addresses only EntitySpecification items extended from RootEntity as EntityCatalogItem.
The EntityCatalogItem resource (JSON format) represents a set of characteristics that define the values given by the EntityCatalogItem.

id.description: Unique identifier of this REST resource

href.description: Hyperlink reference to this REST resource

name.description: Name given to this REST resource

@type.description: Class type of this REST resource

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: The (immediate) base class type of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which this REST resource is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update of this REST resource

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status of this catalog item

Association.description: Association is the class that describe a relationship between two or more entity specifications based on a given association specification. The role and type of each endpoint in the relationship is given by an association role. The type of endpoints in the relationship should match the ones as defined in the corresponding association role specification. A relationship between entity specifications may be governed by conditions and rules which are addressed by constraint references in this resource. Constraints for a relationship may include new rules and conditions in addition to those defined for the corresponding association specification

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: Immediate base class type of this association

validFor.description: The period for which this association is valid

lastUpdate.description: The last modified date of this association object

Catalog.description:
The root entity for entity catalog management. An entity catalog can be defined as a collection of entity catalog items and arranging them in a particular manner based on the need.
In comparison to Product, Service and Resource catalogs, the entity catalog is intended for the purpose of providing any SID entity to consumers via a catalog, with its specification and policy providing governance over its content. Even Entity catalog may have an overlap with Product, Service or Resource catalog, it doesn't replace them. It is primarily intended to address those SID entities which may not be addressed by any of Product, Service or Resource catalog.
An entity catalog comprises of a list of RootEntities made available through EntityCatalogItems. This API addresses only RootEntity extended items as EntitySpecification. An entity catalog typically includes name, description and time period that it is valid for.

@type.description: Indicates the (class) type of catalog. For entity catalogs, this will be 'EntityCatalog'.

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing this REST resource

@baseType.description: Indicates the base (class) type of this REST resource

validFor.description: The period for which the catalog is valid

lastUpdate.description: Date and time of the last update

lifecycleStatus.description: Used to indicate the current lifecycle status

TimePeriod.description: A base / value business entity used to represent a period of time between two timepoints.

startDateTime.description: An instant of time, starting at the TimePeriod

endDateTime.description: An instant of time, ending at the TimePeriod.

Attachment.description: Complements the description of an element (for instance a product) through video, pictures...

description.description: A narrative text describing the content of the attachment

type.description: Attachment type such as video, picture

url.description: Uniform Resource Locator, is a web page address (a subset of URI)

EntitySchemaRef.description: The reference object to the schema and type of target entity which is described by an entity specification

@type.description: Class type of the target entity

@schemaLocation.description: This field provides a link to the schema describing the target entity

SpecCharacteristic.description: A characteristic quality or distinctive feature of a Specification.  The characteristic can be take on a discrete value, such as color, can take on a range of values, (for example, sensitivity of 100-240 mV), or can be derived from a formula (for example, usage time (hrs) = 30 - talk time *3). Certain characteristics, such as color, may be configured during the ordering or some other process.

description.description: A narrative that explains in detail what the SpecCharacteristic is

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

configurable.description: If true, the Boolean indicates that the SpecCharacteristic is configurable

validFor.description: The period for which the productSpecCharacteristic is valid

@schemaLocation.description: A link to the schema describing this characteristic

RelatedPartyRef.description: RelatedParty reference. A related party defines party or party role linked to a specific entity.

id.description: Unique identifier of a related party

href.description: Reference of the related party, could be a party reference or a party role reference

validFor.description: Validity period of the related party

SpecCharacteristicValue.description: A number or text that can be assigned to a SpecCharacteristic

valueType.description: A kind of value that the characteristic value can take on, such as numeric, text and so forth

isDefault.description: If true, the Boolean Indicates if the value is the default value for a characteristic

unitOfMeasure.description: unit of measure for the valueCould be minutes, GB, etc

validFor.description: The period for which this object is valid

valueFrom.description: The low range value that a characteristic can take on

valueTo.description: The upper range value that a characteristic can take on

rangeInterval.description: An indicator that specifies the inclusion or exclusion of the valueFrom and valueTo attributes. If applicable, possible values are "open", "closed", "closedBottom" and "closedTop".

regex.description: A regular expression constraint for given value

value.description: the  value that the characteristic can take on as object
the  value that the characteristic can take on as string

ConstraintRef.description: Constraint reference. The Constraint resource represents a policy/rule applied to an entity or entity spec.

id.description: reference id to the target constraint

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target constraint

AssociationRoleSpec.description: This embedded object represents the role and type of each entity involved in a relationship.

id.description: reference id to the target AssociationSpecification

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the target AssociationSpecification

AssociationRole.description: This embedded object represents the role and type of each entity involved in a relationship.

role.description: The association role of this relationship participant as defined in the associationRoleSpec

isSource.description: A flag indicating if the participant involved in a uni-directional relationship is the source or not. this flag is true If the association is bi-directional (both end points are navigable)

id.description: The identifier of the endpoint plays this role

href.description: Hyperlink reference to the endpoint plays this association role

name.description: Name of the endpoint which plays this association role

@type.description: (class) type of the endpoint which plays this association role

code.description: An integer coding the error type. This is given to caller so he can translate them if required.

message.description: A short localized string that describes the error.

description.description: (optional) A long localized error description if needed. It can contain precise information about which parameter is missing, or what are the identifier acceptable values.

infoURL.description: (optional) A URL to online documentation that provides more information about the error.
